problems.body: The continuous change between the states of matter on Earth's surface through an almost closed system is known as …. cycle.
The percentage of Earth's surface covered with water is …..
Which process of the following if stopped, could directly disturb the balance of water cycle on Earth's surface and in the atmosphere?
An increase in the rate of plant transpiration can indirectly affect the water cycle in nature through ....

choices.body: Increasing water vapor in the atmosphere

problems.body: Which of the following shapes correctly represents the structure of water molecule and the angle between the two covalent bonds?
The polarity of water molecule is due to the fact that .....

choices.body: Oxygen atom in water molecule becomes a positive ion, and hydrogen atom becomes a negative ion.
Electronegativity of hydrogen is greater than electronegativity of oxygen.
Oxygen atom in water molecule carries a partial positive charge, and hydrogen atom carries a partial negative charge.
Oxygen atom in water molecule carries a partial negative charge, and hydrogen atom carries a partial positive charge.

problems.body: The solution resulting from the hydrolysis of ammonium chloride salt is considered acidic because .....

choices.body: The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is less than the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is greater than the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution equals the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is less than or equal to the concentration of H⁺ ions.

problems.body: The solution resulting from the hydrolysis of sodium bicarbonate salt is considered alkaline because......

choices.body: The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is less than the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is greater than the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution equals the concentration of H⁺ ions.
The concentration of OH⁻ ions in the solution is less than or equal to the concentration of H⁺ ions.

problems.body: What are the two elements that make up water molecule?
What is the mass ratio of hydrogen to oxygen, respectively, in a water molecule?
Which of the following correctly describes the composition of the water molecule?

choices.body: The percentage of hydrogen mass in the molecule is 66.67%
The percentage of oxygen mass in the molecule is 33.33%
The percentage of hydrogen mass in the molecule is 11.11%
The percentage of oxygen mass in the molecule is 50%

problems.body: Given that the density of water at 4°C equals 1g/cm³, then when is raised to 8°C .......
Given that the density of water at 4°C equals 1g/cm³, then mass of 4m³ is:
Four samples of water, each is of mass 1 kg. Which sample has the greatest volume?
In the opposite figure, when a large amount of salt is dissolved in pure water, the volume of the submerged part of a hydrometer placed in this water...
Given that the density of water at 4°C equals 1g/cm³, this means .....

choices.body: The mass of 1 cm³ of water equals 4 kg.
The mass of 1 cm³ of water equals 1 g.
The mass of 1 m³ of water equals 1 g.
The mass of 1 cm³ of water equals 1 L.

problems.body: The temperature at which the density of water is at its maximum value is...

The figure shows three cups of water with different salinities, with densities (X, Y, and Z), all at the same temperature. An identical egg was placed in each cup. What is the correct order of water samples according to their densities?
Which of the following devices is used to measure the density of liquids?
The international unit of temperature is...
The freezing point of pure water is equal to...
If a living organism has its genetic material free in the cytoplasm and lacks mitochondria, then this organism is a/an ...
Which of the following correctly links water and metabolic reactions?

choices.body: Water is a medium for biochemical reactions

problems.body: Which of the following factors directly slows down enzyme activity?

choices.body: Raising the temperature above the optimal limit
Availability of substrate molecules in abundance
Increasing the size of the sap vacuole

problems.body: If the nuclear membrane is removed from a eukaryotic cell, the cell with this feature will resemble that of ...
Dysfunction of mitochondria in the cell directly leads to ...

title: Biological Adaptations of Organisms in the Aquatic Environment

problems.body: Which of the following is considered a physiological adaptation for ocean fish?
Which of the following adaptations enables deep-sea fish to cope with oxygen deficiency?
What type of osmotic adaptation is found in salmon fish?
The figure shows the migration of salmon fish, which is considered:

choices.body: Both behavioral and functional adaptation together

problems.body: Icefish live in the cold Southern Oceans at depths of up to approximately........
The streamlined body, mucus, and scales in fish help reduce water resistance to their movement. This is considered a _____ adaptation.
What is the importance of the swim bladder for bony fish?

choices.body: It improves the fish's ability to extract oxygen.
It reduces water resistance to their movement.
It makes fish withstand high pressure in the depths.

title: Effect of Atmospheric Gases on Aquatic Environments

problems.body: All of the following are sources of dissolved carbon dioxide in water, except:
From the two graphs, it is clear that by raising the temperature:

choices.body: The solubility of O₂ decreases at a greater rate than the decrease in the solubility of CO₂.
The solubility of CO₂ decreases at a greater rate than the decrease in the solubility of O₂.
The solubility of both O₂ and CO₂ decreases at the same rate.
The solubility of both O₂ and CO₂ increases at the same rate.

problems.body: An increase in the percentage of CO₂ gas in water leads to.............

choices.body: Increased water acidification, and increased coral calcification.
Increased water acidification, and reduced coral calcification.
Reduced water acidification, and increased coral calcification.
Reduced water acidification, and reduced coral calcification.

problems.body: Which of the following causes a decrease in pH value of water?

choices.body: Increase in dissolved O₂ in water
Increase in dissolved CO₂ in water
Decrease in dissolved O₂ in water
Decrease in dissolved CO₂ in water

problems.body: When carbon dioxide gas combines with water, it produces .................. acid.
An increase in the percentage of dissolved carbon dioxide gas in water leads to converting:

choices.body: Calcium carbonate, which does not dissolve in water, into calcium bicarbonate, which dissolves in water.
Calcium carbonate, which dissolves in water, into calcium bicarbonate, which does not dissolve in water.
Calcium bicarbonate, which does not dissolve in water, into calcium carbonate, which dissolves in water.
Calcium bicarbonate, which dissolves in water, into calcium carbonate, which does not dissolve in water.

title: Effect of Light and Solar Radiation on Aquatic Environments

problems.body: As water depth increases, the intensity of light under the water surface...
Which of the following statements represents the correct order of the light zones in water according to their depth from top to bottom?

choices.body: Twilight zone – Dark zone – Sunlit zone
Dark zone – Sunlit zone – Twilight zone
Sunlit zone – Twilight zone – Dark zone
Twilight zone – Sunlit zone – Dark zone

problems.body: The amount of light that penetrates the water surface is greatest when the angle between the incident sun's rays and the water surface equals...
Which of the following light colors is absorbed first after penetrating the surface of a body of water?
Which of the following statements is correct?

choices.body: Water depth affects only the absorption of light.
Water depth affects only the intensity of light.
Water depth affects both the absorption and intensity of light.
Water depth affects neither the absorption nor the intensity of light.

problems.body: Photosynthesis mainly occurs in the ........... layers of bodies of water.

title: Effect of Water Pressure on Living Organisms

problems.body: A liquid has pressure at any point inside it that is equal to the weight of the liquid column above that point, and act on the unit of area around that point.
Water pressure increases by approximately .................. for every 10 meters below the surface.
What is the main function of the swim bladder in fish that live at intermediate depths?

choices.body: Producing heat to maintain body temperature.

problems.body: How do fish that live at great depths adapt to high pressure?

choices.body: By increasing the size of their swim bladder.
By increasing the size of their gills.

problems.body: What is the importance of lipoproteins in the cell membranes of marine organisms that live in the depths?

title: Ecological Balance and the Role of Humans in the Sustainability of Aquatic Life

problems.body: The role of predatory fish in maintaining ecological balance in aquatic ecosystems is:

choices.body: Reducing the number of small fish
Controlling the number of predatory fish

problems.body: When nutrient levels in an aquatic ecosystem are excessive, it leads to:
Which of the following is an example of the impact of overfishing on ecological balance?

choices.body: Decline in numbers of predatory fish

problems.body: What is the main cause of biodiversity loss in aquatic ecosystems?
The role of humans in maintaining ecological balance is:
What is the primary strategy for protecting aquatic ecosystems?
Which of the following is NOT a role that humans can play to help maintain ecological balance?

choices.body: Avoiding pollution and overuse of resource

problems.body: Sustainable development contributes to maintaining ecological balance by:

choices.body: Ignoring the needs of future generations

problems.body: Which of the following human activities positively contributes to maintaining ecological balance?

choices.body: Increasing fertilizer use in aquatic environments

problems.body: What is the most effective way to rise awareness about ecological balance?

choices.body: Conducting environmental awareness campaigns in schools and through media
Reducing the study of ecosystems in school curricula

problems.body: Which of the following is NOT a negative impact of human activities on aquatic ecosystems?

choices.body: Pollution from pesticides and heavy metals
Destruction of natural habitats, such as coral reefs

problems.body: How can humans contribute effectively to preserving natural resources?

choices.body: By using resources sustainably and avoiding overexploitation
By destroying coral reefs for economic purposes

problems.body: How does energy flow in an aquatic food web?

choices.body: From producers, such as algae, to consumers, such as herbivorous and predatory fish
From deep-sea organisms to surface-dwelling organisms

problems.body: One of the major consequences of not protecting aquatic ecosystems is:
What is the main purpose of maintaining ecological balance in aquatic ecosystems?

choices.body: To increase the population of all organisms
To ensure the continuous flow of energy through the food web
To increase the production of fish and other seafood
To maintain the dynamic stability of the ecosystem

problems.body: Which of the following human activities can lead to ecological imbalance in aquatic ecosystems?
Which of the following is not a strategy humans can use to maintain ecological balance in aquatic ecosystems?

title: Components and Layers of the Atmosphere

problems.body: Although nitrogen gas is highly abundant in the atmosphere, its oxides are found in very small quantities because...

choices.body: Nitrogen gas is produced from the decomposition of animals and plants.
There is a strong triple bond between the two nitrogen atoms in its molecule, making it largely inert.
It reacts with oxygen at low temperatures.
It reacts with oxygen during natural phenomena such as rainfall.

problems.body: The most abundant gas in Earth's atmosphere is ............
Oxygen gas makes up approximately .......... of the volume of atmospheric air.
The layer that absorbs short-wavelength ultraviolet (UV) radiation is ..........
The ozone layer in the atmosphere extends approximately from an altitude of .......... above Earth's surface.
The thickness of the thermosphere is approximately ..........
What is the temperature at the top of a mountain 2 km high, if the air temperature at ground level is 5°C?
The layer of the atmosphere with the lowest temperature, reaching approximately –93°C, is:
Which of the following could represent the first step in the formation of ozone gas?
Ozone can absorb photons with a wavelength equal to...
What type of reaction is represented by the equation O₂ → O + O?
When the bond between the two oxygen atoms in an oxygen molecule breaks due to photodissociation...

choices.body: one oxygen atom (O) and one oxygen ion (O⁻²)
two single oxygen atoms (O) and two oxygen ion (O⁻²)

problems.body: Which of the following ultraviolet wavelengths causes photodissociation of the covalent bond in an oxygen molecule?
An ozone molecule is formed by the combination of...

choices.body: one individual oxygen atom (O) and one oxygen molecule (O₂)

problems.body: Smog is formed as a result of the accumulation of products from all the following reactions except...

choices.body: the reaction of nitrogen and atmospheric oxygen during lightning
the reaction of oxygen with sulfur under suitable conditions
the reaction of hydrogen with oxygen under suitable conditions
the reaction of nitrogen oxides with hydrocarbons in the presence of sunlight

problems.body: Which of the following options represents some of the health effects of ozone gas on humans?

choices.body: Cataracts, skin cancer, and decline in bee populations
Skin cancer, weakened immunity, and destruction of plankton
Reduced photosynthesis, impaired brain development, and delayed child growth

title: Physical Factors and Their Effect on the Atmosphere

problems.body: ........... is used to measure atmospheric pressure.
If the atmospheric pressure at the top of a mountain is 750mm.Hg, it equals ....... (Given that the usual atmospheric pressure equals 1.013x10⁵ N/m² = 76 cm.Hg)
Which of the following correctly expresses the effect of atmospheric pressure on the amount of oxygen available for breathing?

choices.body: Less in areas of low pressure
More in areas of low pressure
Equal in all areas of different pressures
The amount in low-pressure areas is less than or equal to that in high-pressure areas

problems.body: A body with a temperature of 283 K equals ........... on the Fahrenheit scale.
The boiling point of pure water equals ........
Mount Sinai is approximately 2285 meters above sea level. If the temperature at the base of the mountain is 32°C, the temperature at an altitude of 528 meters above the base equals:
8 millibar = …………………….
Which of the following expresses a form of adaptation to freezing?

choices.body: Producing a large amount of proteins before entering hibernation, as in the wood frog
Producing a large amount of fats before entering hibernation, as in the wood frog
Producing a large amount of antifreeze proteins, as in the ice fish
Producing a large amount of antifreeze glucose, as in the ice fish

title: The Atmosphere and the Role of Science in Its Sustainability

problems.body: All of the following are greenhouse gases that cause global warming except:
All of the following are negative effects of global warming except:

choices.body: melting ice and flooding of coasts
decreased biodiversity due to extinction of polar organisms
decreased biodiversity due to extinction of desert organisms

problems.body: The increase in greenhouse gases in the atmosphere prevents the penetration of ____________, causing global warming.
The main role of emissions from burning fossil fuels in causing global warming is...

choices.body: increasing Earth's surface absorption of sunlight.
forming a layer in the atmosphere that traps heat and prevents it from escaping.
directly reacting with polar ice, causing its melting.
increasing the amount of oxygen in the air, which raises its temperature.

problems.body: Earth's surface absorbs short-wavelength solar radiation and then re-emits it in the form of...
